text:
“Why, had you forgotten?” 

“No, I remember.”

“I heard my father speak of you. I asked, ‘Where does Mr. Raskolnikov live?’”

Sonia hurried away, looking down. She wanted to escape, to be alone. 

“Only not to-day, please, not to-day!” she muttered, panic rising. 

A stranger followed her, curious about her words. 

He turned to Raskolnikov, studying him closely.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia feels a mix of anxiety and anticipation as she reflects on her encounter with Raskolnikov, sensing a new world opening before her.
